tn.ref: Set apart to me ... every firstborn male
tn.text: God requires that every firstborn male child be set apart for him.

tn.ref: Call this day to mind
tn.text: The words "Call ... to mind" were a customary way of telling someone to remember something. AT: "Remember and celebrate this day" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]] and [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])

tn.ref: the house of slavery
tn.text: Moses speaks of Egypt as if it were a house where people keep slaves. AT: "the place where you were slaves" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])

tn.ref: Yahweh's strong hand
tn.text: Here the word "hand" refers to power. See how you translated "strong hand" in [[:en:bible:notes:exo:06:01|6:1]]. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

tn.ref: No bread with yeast may be eaten
tn.text: This can be stated in active form. AT: "You must not eat bread with yeast" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: the month of Abib
tn.text: This is the name of the first month of the Hebrew calendar. Abib is during the last part of March and the first part of April on Western calendars. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_hebrewmonths]] and [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])

tn.ref: a land flowing with milk and honey
tn.text: Since milk comes from cows and goats, "milk" represents food produced by livestock. Because honey is produced from flowers, "honey" represents food from crops. See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:exo:03:07|3:8]]. AT: "food from livestock and from crops" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

tn.ref: you must observe this act of worship
tn.text: When the Israelites live in Canaan, they must celebrate the Passover on this day each year. See how you translated this phrase in [[:en:bible:notes:exo:12:24|12:25]].

tn.ref: General Information:
tn.text: Moses continues to speak to the people of Israel.

tn.ref: For seven days
tn.text: "For 7 days" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_numbers]])

tn.ref: Bread without yeast must be eaten
tn.text: This can be stated in active form. AT: "You must eat bread without yeast" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: no bread with yeast may be seen among you
tn.text: This can be stated in active form. AT: "You may not have any bread with yeast among you" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: No yeast may be seen with you
tn.text: This can be stated in active form. AT: "You may not have any yeast" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: within any of your borders
tn.text: "inside any of the borders of your land"

tn.ref: On that day you are to say to your children, 'This is because of what Yahweh did for me when I came out of Egypt.'
tn.text: The quotation can be stated as an indirect quote. AT: "On that day you are to tell your children that this is because of what Yahweh did for you when you came out of Egypt" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_quotations]])

tn.ref: This will be a reminder for you on your hand, and a reminder on your forehead
tn.text: These are two different types of physical reminders so people will not forget something important. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_parallelism]])

tn.ref: a reminder for you on your hand
tn.text: Moses speaks of celebrating the festival as if it were tying an object around their hands to remind them of what Yahweh had done. AT: "like something you tie around your hand as a reminder" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])

tn.ref: a reminder on your forehead
tn.text: Moses speaks of celebrating the festival as if it were tying an object around their foreheads to remind them of what Yahweh had done. AT: "like something you tie around your head as a reminder" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])

tn.ref: so the law of Yahweh may be in your mouth
tn.text: The words "in your mouth" here refers to the words that they speak. AT: "so you may always be speaking of the law of Yahweh" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

tn.ref: strong hand
tn.text: The word "hand" here represents God's actions or works. See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:exo:06:01|6:1]]. AT: "the power I show in my works" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

tn.ref: and when he gives the land to you
tn.text: "and when he gives the land of the Canaanites to you"

tn.ref: Every firstborn of a donkey
tn.text: Israel is given a choice to kill the firstborn donkey or buy it back with a lamb.

tn.ref: each of your firstborn males among all your sons
tn.text: Everyone in Israel who had a firstborn son, must buy him back.

tn.ref: When your son asks you later, 'What does this mean?' then you are to tell him
tn.text: The first quotation can be stated as an indirect quotation. AT: "When your son asks you later what this means, then you are to tell him" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_quotations]])

tn.ref: strong hand
tn.text: The word "hand" here represents God's actions or works. See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:exo:06:01|6:1]]. AT: "the power I show in my works" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

tn.ref: the house of slavery
tn.text: Moses speaks of Egypt as if it were a house where people keep slaves. See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:exo:13:03|13:3]]. AT: "the place where you were slaves" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])

tn.ref: become a reminder on your hands, and a reminder on your forehead
tn.text: This expresses two ways to remember the importance of the passover event. See how you translated a similar phrase in [[:en:bible:notes:exo:13:08|13:8-10]]. (See [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_parallelism]])

tn.ref: nearby
tn.text: "close to where they were located"

tn.ref: the people will change their minds ... and ... return to Egypt
tn.text: Since Israelites had lived in slavery all their lives, they were more accustomed to peace than to war and would rather return to slavery than fight.

tn.ref: camped at Etham
tn.text: Etham is located south of the route heading towards the Philistines, at the border of the wilderness. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])

tn.ref: pillar of cloud ... pillar of fire
tn.text: "a cloud in the shape of a column ... fire in the shape of a column." God is with them in a cloud by day and in a fire by night.
